name: 黃柏鈞
objective:
(Tentative)
本課程講授次世代記憶－儲存媒體之軟硬體技術、記憶體架構、存取特性、以及管理策略。此外，本課程亦將討論不同記憶－儲存系統，如檔案系統、資料庫、NoSQL資料庫、Key/Value儲存、內容感知儲存、近似儲存等之架構與設計，以及記憶體中運算等創新之關鍵技術。

請注意本課程以全英語授課，並採用全英語教材。
This course introduces the hardware/software technologies, architecture, access characteristics, and management strategies of next-generation memory/storage media. In addition, we shall also cover the architecture and design issues of various memory–storage systems, such as file systems, databases, NoSQL databases, key–value store, content-aware storage, and approximate storage. The key technologies such as processing-in-memory (PIM) are also discussed. 

Please note that this course is given in full English, and adopts full-English materials.
schedule:
(Tentative)
- Week 1. Modern computer architecture
- Week 2. The memory hierarchy
- Week 3. Software–hardware collaboration for memory hierarchy management
- Week 4. SRAM and DRAM (I): basic characteristics
- Week 5. SRAM and DRAM (II): memory management in Linux
- Week 6. Mechanical hard disk (I): basic characteristics
- Week 7. Mechanical hard disk (II): disk scheduler and defragmentation techniques
- Week 8. Shingled magnetic recording disk (SMRD): theory and practice in Linux
- Week 9. NAND flash memory (I): basic characteristics and the flash translation layer (FTL)
- Week 10. NAND flash memory (II): address mapping, space allocation, and wear leveling algorithms
- Week 11. NAND flash memory (III): flash-aware data structures and march-like testing of flash chips
- Week 12. Phase-change memory (PCM) (I): basic characteristics
- Week 13. Phase-change memory (PCM) (II): write reduction techniques
- Week 14. Spin-torque-transfer random-access memory (STT-RAM), resistive random-access memory (ReRAM), and racetrack memory (RM)
- Week 15. Architecture of solid-state disks (SSDs)
- Week 16. File system basics
- Week 17. File system forensics
- Week 18. Advanced topics: Approximate storage and processing-in-memory (PIM)
